channel.title: Turning my server online
channel.description: hey guys, i have a question about turning my server online, i have already portfowarded and done everything, but where do i change my ip? do i change it on the source? if so what files do i change it on? or do i change on the client, if so what files? it would really help if you could teamview me. thanks

item.title: Turning my server online
item.dc:creator: @Marine5287 Marine5287
item.description:
@Marine5287 wrote:

This is client sided because usually when you download a source from this site, all you need to do is go in the client.java and search “127.0.0.1” and don’t change the one where you see “Local Host” next to it, but change the other ones. Also when you’re coding, make sure you take your time so you don’t mess up then have to post on here again XD

Read full topic

item.title: Turning my server online
item.dc:creator: @Fury4 Fury_
item.description:
@Fury4 wrote:

After you have port forwarded change server IP to you’re IP (client.java, gui.java if you don’t got gui.java look in: ugui.java) Then upload it etc.
(you must connect to 127.0.0.1 or 0.0.0.0 while others play on the IP)

Read full topic

item.title: Turning my server online
item.dc:creator: @MrMud MrMud
item.description:
@MrMud wrote:

no… in Client.java, GUI.java or EGUI.java look for 127.0.0.1 or localhost and change the ip to your ip
www.whatsmyip.org

Read full topic

x1 att ftw x:
